cards.name: Stasis
cards.text:
Players skip their untap steps.
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Stasis unless you pay {U}.

rulings.text: Since there is no untap step, Phasing in/out won't happen.
Does not prevent cards from being untapped outside the untap step.

cards.originalText: Players do not get an untap phase. During your upkeep, pay {U} or destroy Stasis.

cards.name: Steal Artifact
cards.text:
Enchant artifact
You control enchanted artifact.

rulings.text: Can be used on artifact creatures.

cards.originalText: Gain control of target artifact.

cards.name: Stone Giant
cards.text: {T}: Target creature you control with toughness less than Stone Giant's power gains flying until end of turn. Destroy that creature at the beginning of the next end step.

rulings.text: If the Giant's power and/or toughness change so that its toughness is less than its power, you can have the ability target the Giant itself.
To work as an evasion ability, an attacking creature must already have flying when the declare blockers step begins. Once a creature has become blocked, giving it flying won't change that.

If Stone Giant's ability is activated during a turn's end step, the delayed triggered ability won't trigger until the beginning of the next turn's end step. The targeted creature will be destroyed at that time.

When the delayed triggered ability resolves, the targeted creature is destroyed, even if it's no longer a creature, no longer under your control, or no longer has toughness less than Stone Giant's power at that time.

cards.originalText: {T}: Target creature you control, which must have toughness less than Stone Giant's power, gains flying until end of turn. Destroy that creature at end of turn. Other effects may later be used to increase the creature's toughness beyond Stone Giant's power.

cards.name: Stone Rain
cards.text: Destroy target land.
cards.originalText: Destroy target land.

cards.name: Stream of Life
cards.text: Target player gains X life.
cards.originalText: Target player gains X life.

cards.name: Strip Mine
cards.text:
{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.
{T}, Sacrifice Strip Mine: Destroy target land.
cards.flavor: Unlike previous conflicts, the war between Urza and Mishra made Dominia itself a casualty of war.
cards.originalText:
{T}: Add one colorless mana to your mana pool.
{T}: Sacrifice Strip Mine to destroy target land.

cards.name: Sunglasses of Urza
cards.text: You may spend white mana as though it were red mana.
cards.originalText: You may use white mana in your mana pool as either white or red mana.

cards.name: Sunken City
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Sunken City unless you pay {U}{U}.
Blue creatures get +1/+1.
cards.originalText: All blue creatures get +1/+1. During your upkeep, pay {U}{U} or destroy Sunken City.

cards.name: Swamp
cards.originalText: {T}: Add {B} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Swamp
cards.originalText: {T}: Add {B} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Swamp
cards.originalText: {T}: Add {B} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Swords to Plowshares
cards.text: Exile target creature. Its controller gains life equal to its power.

rulings.text: The amount of life gained is equal to the power of the targeted creature as it last existed on the battlefield.
If the creature's power is negative, its controller doesn't lose or gain life.

cards.originalText: Remove target creature from the game. The creature's controller gains life equal to its power.

cards.name: Sylvan Library
cards.text: At the beginning of your draw step, you may draw two additional cards. If you do, choose two cards in your hand drawn this turn. For each of those cards, pay 4 life or put the card on top of your library.

rulings.text: You always perform your normal draw before this ability. The normal draw occurs before anything can be placed on the stack during a player's draw step.

If you control other triggered abilities that allow you to draw cards during your draw step, you can choose to order Sylvan Library's ability before or after those abilities. Triggered abilities controlled by other players will resolve before triggered abilities you control.

Any cards drawn prior to Sylvan Library's ability resolving, including in your upkeep or in response to Sylvan Library's triggered ability, can be chosen to be put back using this effect. Sylvan Library's controller is responsible for keeping these cards distinguishable in hand, such as by keeping them separate from cards that began the turn in hand.
If you control more than one Sylvan Library, the triggered ability of each will resolve in sequence. You don't get to draw all the cards at once and then put them all back at once.
You can put back zero, one, or two cards.

If you choose to draw two cards, then replace one or more of those draws with some other effect, the rest of Sylvan Library's ability still happens. If you've actually drawn only one card that turn, you must choose that card and either pay 4 life or put it on top of your library. If you haven't actually drawn any cards that turn, the rest of the ability has no effect.
It's not possible to take any actions between drawing the cards and choosing two cards. You can't cast the cards you drew to avoid having two cards to choose.

cards.originalText: You may draw two extra cards during your draw phase. If you do so, put two of the cards drawn this turn back on top of your library (in any order) or pay 4 life per card not replaced. Effects that prevent or redirect damage cannot be used to counter this loss of life.

cards.name: Tawnos's Wand
cards.text: {2}, {T}: Target creature with power 2 or less can't be blocked this turn.
cards.originalText: {2}, {T}: Target creature with power no greater than 2 becomes unblockable until end of turn. Other effects may later be used to increase the creature's power beyond 2.

cards.name: Tawnos's Weaponry
cards.text:
You may choose not to untap Tawnos's Weaponry during your untap step.
{2}, {T}: Target creature gets +1/+1 for as long as Tawnos's Weaponry remains tapped.
cards.flavor: When war machines became too costly, Tawnos's Weaponry replaced them.
cards.originalText:
{2}, {T}: Target creature gets +1/+1 as long as Tawnos's Weaponry remains tapped.
You may choose not to untap Tawnos's Weaponry during your untap phase.

cards.name: Tempest Efreet
cards.text:
Remove Tempest Efreet from your deck before playing if you're not playing for ante.
{T}, Sacrifice Tempest Efreet: Target opponent may pay 10 life. If that player doesn't, he or she reveals a card at random from his or her hand. Exchange ownership of the revealed card and Tempest Efreet. Put the revealed card into your hand and Tempest Efreet from anywhere into that player's graveyard. This change in ownership is permanent.
cards.originalText: {T}: Choose a card at random from target opponent's hand and put it in yours. Bury Tempest Efreet in opponent's graveyard. The change in ownership is permanent. Play this ability as an interrupt. Before you choose the card to be switched, the opponent may prevent effect by paying 10 life or conceding game; if this is done, bury Tempest Efreet. Effects that prevent or redirect damage cannot be used to counter this loss of life. Remove Tempest Efreet from your deck before playing if not playing for ante.

cards.name: Terror
cards.text: Destroy target nonartifact, nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.
cards.originalText: Bury target non-black, non-artifact creature.

cards.name: Tetravus
cards.text:
Flying
Tetravus enters the battlefield with three +1/+1 counters on it.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may remove any number of +1/+1 counters from Tetravus. If you do, create that many 1/1 colorless Tetravite artifact creature tokens. They each have flying and "This creature can't be enchanted."
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may exile any number of tokens put onto the battlefield with Tetravus. If you do, put that many +1/+1 counters on Tetravus.

rulings.text: If the Tetravus is destroyed when the Tetravites are off the card, they are not destroyed, they are just orphaned.
Any +1/+1 counter which is on this card can be turned into a Tetravite token. It does not care where the +1/+1 counter came from.
Only Tetravites from this specific Tetravus may be used for the ability. Ones from a different Tetravus can't.
This card now has two upkeep-triggered abilities. Its controller chooses the order they are put on the stack, and thus the order in which they resolve each upkeep.

cards.originalText:
Flying
When Tetravus comes into play, put three +1/+1 counters on it.
During your upkeep, you may move each of these counters on or off of Tetravus, regardless of who controls them. Counters that are removed become Tetravite tokens. Treat these tokens as 1/1 artifact creatures with flying. These creatures cannot have enchantment played on them and do not share any enchantments on Tetravus.

cards.name: The Brute
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+0.
{R}{R}{R}: Regenerate enchanted creature.
cards.flavor:
"Union may be strength, but it is mere blind brute strength unless wisely directed."
—Samuel Butler
cards.originalText:
Target creature gets +1/+0.
{R}{R}{R}: Regenerate target creature The Brute enchants.

cards.name: The Hive
cards.text: {5}, {T}: Create a 1/1 colorless Insect artifact creature token with flying named Wasp. (It can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
cards.originalText: 5, {T}: Put a Wasp token into play. Treat this token as a 1/1 artifact creature with flying.

cards.name: The Rack
cards.text:
As The Rack enters the battlefield, choose an opponent.
At the beginning of the chosen player's upkeep, The Rack deals X damage to that player, where X is 3 minus the number of cards in his or her hand.
cards.flavor: Invented in Mishra's earlier days, the Rack was once his most feared creation.

rulings.text: You choose one opposing player as this card enters the battlefield and it only affects that one player. This choice is not changed even if this card changes controllers. It becomes useless but stays on the battlefield if the chosen player leaves the battlefield.

cards.originalText: At the end of target opponent's upkeep, The Rack deals that player 1 damage for each card in his or her hand fewer than three.

cards.name: Thicket Basilisk
cards.text: Whenever Thicket Basilisk blocks or becomes blocked by a non-Wall creature, destroy that creature at end of combat.
cards.flavor: Moss-covered statues littered the area, a macabre monument to the Basilisk's power.

rulings.text: Protection from Green does not stop the Basilisk's ability because the ability is not targeted.

The ability destroys the creature at the end of the combat, which is after all first strike and normal damage dealing is done. This means that a creature may have to regenerate twice to survive the combat, once from damage and once again at end of combat.

cards.originalText: At the end of combat, destroy all non-wall creatures blocking or blocked by Basilisk.

cards.name: Thoughtlace
cards.text: Target spell or permanent becomes blue. (Mana symbols on that permanent remain unchanged.)
cards.originalText: Change the color of target spell or target permanent to blue. Costs to cast, tap, maintain, or use a special ability of target remain unchanged.

cards.name: Throne of Bone
cards.text: Whenever a player casts a black spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.
cards.originalText: {1}: Gain 1 life for a successfully cast black spell. Use this effect either when the spell is cast or later in the turn but only once for each black spell cast.

cards.name: Timber Wolves
cards.text: Banding (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)
cards.flavor: Though many think of Wolves as solitary predators, they are actually extremely social animals. During a hunt they often call to each other, which can be quite unsettling for their prey.

rulings.text: If a creature with banding attacks, it can team up with any number of other attacking creatures with banding (and up to one nonbanding creature) and attack as a unit called a "band." The band can be blocked by any creature that could block a single creature in the band. Blocking any creature in a band blocks the entire band. If a creature with banding is blocked, the attacking player chooses how the blockers' damage is assigned.
A maximum of one nonbanding creature can join an attacking band no matter how many creatures with banding are in it.
Creatures in the same band must all attack the same player or planeswalker.
If a creature in combat has banding, its controller assigns damage for creatures blocking or blocked by it. That player can ignore the damage assignment order when making this assignment.

cards.originalText: Banding

cards.name: Time Elemental
cards.text:
When Time Elemental attacks or blocks, at end of combat, sacrifice it and it deals 5 damage to you.
{2}{U}{U}, {T}: Return target permanent that isn't enchanted to its owner's hand.

rulings.text: You both sacrifice it and deal the 5 damage at end of combat.
A "permanent that isn't enchanted" is a permanent with no Auras on it.
If Time Elemental attacks or blocks, but you no longer control it at end of combat, you can't sacrifice it. However, it will still deal 5 damage to you.

cards.originalText: {2}{U}{U}, {T}: Return target permanent to owner's hand. You cannot use this ability on permanents with enchantment cards played on them. If Time Elemental blocks or attacks, destroy it at end of combat. In this case, Time Elemental deals 5 damage to its controller.

cards.name: Titania's Song
cards.text: Each noncreature artifact loses all abilities and becomes an artifact creature with power and toughness each equal to its converted mana cost. If Titania's Song leaves the battlefield, this effect continues until end of turn.

rulings.text: A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of his or her most recent turn. It doesn't matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

cards.originalText: All non-creature artifacts lose all their usual abilities and become artifact creatures with toughness and power each equal to their casting costs. If Titania's Song leaves play, artifacts return to normal just before the untap phase of the next turn.

cards.name: Tranquility
cards.text: Destroy all enchantments.
cards.originalText: Destroy all enchantments.

cards.name: Triskelion
cards.text:
Triskelion enters the battlefield with three +1/+1 counters on it.
Remove a +1/+1 counter from Triskelion: Triskelion deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
cards.flavor: A brainchild of Tawnos, the Triskelion later proved both versatile and useful.

rulings.text: If you activate the ability of an attacking or blocking Triskelion during the declare blockers step, it will deal less combat damage as a result. If you wait until the combat damage step, but Triskelion is dealt lethal damage, it'll be destroyed before you get a chance to activate its ability.

If Triskelion has damage marked on it, activating its ability may cause that damage to become lethal. For example, say a Triskelion with two +1/+1 counters on it has been dealt 2 damage earlier in the turn. If you activate its ability by removing a +1/+1 counter from it, it now has 2 toughness and is destroyed as a state-based action. You won't be able to remove the other +1/+1 counter from it to activate its ability again. The first activation of the ability will still resolve.

cards.originalText:
When Triskelion comes into play, put three +1/+1 counters on it.
{0}: Remove one of these counters from Triskelion to have Triskelion deal 1 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Tsunami
cards.text: Destroy all Islands.
cards.originalText: Destroy all islands.

cards.name: Tundra Wolves
cards.text: First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
cards.flavor: I heard their eerie howling, the wolves calling their kindred across the frozen plains.
cards.originalText: First strike

cards.name: Tunnel
cards.text: Destroy target Wall. It can't be regenerated.
cards.originalText: Bury target wall.

cards.name: Twiddle
cards.text: You may tap or untap target artifact, creature, or land.

rulings.text: This is not a toggle effect. If you use Twiddle to tap a card and before it takes effect your opponent taps it, Twiddle will not automatically untap the card.
The decision whether or not to tap or untap is made on resolution. This is not a modal spell.

cards.originalText: Tap or untap target land, artifact, or creature.

cards.name: Uncle Istvan
cards.text: Prevent all damage that would be dealt to Uncle Istvan by creatures.
cards.flavor: Solitude drove the old hermit insane. Now he only keeps company with those he can catch.

rulings.text: Works even on damage from activated abilities of creatures such as Prodigal Sorcerer.

cards.originalText: All damage done to Uncle Istvan by creatures is reduced to 0.

cards.name: Unholy Strength
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+1.
cards.originalText: Target creature gets +2/+1.

cards.name: Unstable Mutation
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +3/+3.
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted creature's controller, put a -1/-1 counter on that creature.

rulings.text: The -1/-1 counters stay even if the Aura is removed, and the +3/+3 goes away when the Aura does.

cards.originalText: Target creature gets +3/+3. During each of its controller's upkeeps, put a -1/-1 counter on the creature. These counters remain even if Unstable Mutation is removed.

cards.name: Unsummon
cards.text: Return target creature to its owner's hand.
cards.originalText: Return target creature to owner's hand.

cards.name: Untamed Wilds
cards.text: Search your library for a basic land card and put that card onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.

rulings.text: Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.
Can fetch a snow land.

cards.originalText: Search your library for any one basic land and put it directly into play. This does not count towards your one land per turn limit. Reshuffle your library afterwards.

cards.name: Urza's Avenger
cards.text: {0}: Urza's Avenger gets -1/-1 and gains your choice of banding, flying, first strike, or trample until end of turn. (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)
cards.flavor: Unable to settle on just one design, Urza decided to create one versatile being.

rulings.text: The -1/-1 is not permanent. It lasts until the end of the turn as do the abilities that are granted.

cards.originalText: {0}: Urza's Avenger gets -1/-1 until end of turn and your choice of flying, banding, first strike, or trample until end of turn.

cards.name: Uthden Troll
cards.text: {R}: Regenerate Uthden Troll.
cards.flavor:
"Oi oi oi, me gotta hurt in 'ere,
Oi oi oi, me smell a ting is near,
Gonna bosh 'n gonna nosh
'n da hurt'll disappear."
—Troll chant
cards.originalText: {R}: Regenerate

cards.name: Vampire Bats
cards.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
{B}: Vampire Bats gets +1/+0 until end of turn. Activate this ability no more than twice each turn.
cards.flavor:
"For something is amiss or out of place
When mice with wings can wear a human face."
—Theodore Roethke, "The Bat"
cards.originalText:
Flying
{B}: +1/+0 until end of turn. You cannot spend more than {B}{B} in this way each turn.

cards.name: Venom
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Whenever enchanted creature blocks or becomes blocked by a non-Wall creature, destroy the other creature at end of combat.
cards.flavor:
"I told him it was just a flesh wound, but the next time I looked at him, poor Tadhg was dead and gone."
—Maeveen O'Donagh, Memoirs of a Soldier

rulings.text: If this Aura is moved onto a creature after blockers are declared, creatures blocking the newly-enchanted creature are not affected. This is because the ability triggers at the time blocking occurs.

cards.originalText: At the end of combat, destroy all non-wall creatures blocking or blocked by target creature.

cards.name: Verduran Enchantress
cards.text: Whenever you cast an enchantment spell, you may draw a card.
cards.flavor: Some say magic was first practiced by women, who have always felt strong ties to the land.
cards.originalText: {0}: Draw a card when you successfully cast an enchantment. Use this effect only once for each enchantment cast.

cards.name: Visions
cards.text: Look at the top five cards of target player's library. You may then have that player shuffle that library.
cards.flavor:
"Visions of glory, spare my aching sight,
Ye unborn ages, crowd not on my soul!"
—Thomas Gray, "The Bard"

rulings.text: You can't rearrange the cards. You put them back in the same order or have the whole library shuffled.
If there are less than 5 cards in the library, you look at whatever ones remain and you still get the option to shuffle.
This is not a draw and will not cause a player to lose if there are less than 5 cards in the library.

cards.originalText: Look at the top five cards of any library. You may then shuffle that library.

cards.name: Volcanic Eruption
cards.text: Destroy X target Mountains. Volcanic Eruption deals damage to each creature and each player equal to the number of Mountains put into a graveyard this way.

rulings.text: Can be used with X equal to zero. This is useful if no Mountains are on the battlefield.

cards.originalText: Destroy X target mountains. Volcanic Eruption deals 1 damage to each creature and player for each mountain put into the graveyard in this way.

cards.name: Wall of Air
cards.text: Defender, flying (This creature can't attack, and it can block creatures with flying.)
cards.flavor: "This ‘standing windstorm' can hold us off indefinitely? Ridiculous!" Saying nothing, she put a pinch of salt on the table. With a bang she clapped her hands, and the salt disappeared, blown away.
cards.originalText: Flying

cards.name: Wall of Bone
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{B}: Regenerate Wall of Bone. (The next time this creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)
cards.flavor: The Wall of Bone is said to be an aspect of the Great Wall in Hel, where the bones of all sinners wait for Ragnarok, when Hela will call them forth for the final battle.
cards.originalText: {B}: Regenerate

cards.name: Wall of Brambles
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{G}: Regenerate Wall of Brambles.
cards.flavor:
"What else, when chaos
draws all forces inward
to shape a single leaf."
—Conrad Aiken
cards.originalText: {G}: Regenerate

cards.name: Wall of Dust
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Whenever Wall of Dust blocks a creature, that creature can't attack during its controller's next turn.
cards.flavor: An ever-moving swarm of dust engulfs and disorients anything that comes near.
cards.originalText: No creature blocked by Wall of Dust may attack during its controller's next turn.

cards.name: Wall of Fire
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{R}: Wall of Fire gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Conjured from the bowels of hell, the fiery wall forms an impassable barrier, searing the soul of any creature attempting to pass through its terrible bursts of flame.
cards.originalText: {R}: +1/+0 until end of turn

cards.name: Wall of Ice
cards.text: Defender (This creature can't attack.)
cards.flavor:
"And through the drifts the snowy cliffs
Did send a dismal sheen:
Nor shapes of men nor beasts we ken—
The ice was all between."
—Samuel Coleridge, "The Rime of the Ancient Mariner"

cards.name: Wall of Spears
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
First strike
cards.flavor: Even the most conservative generals revised their tactics after the Battle of Sarinth, during which a handful of peasant-pikemen held off a trio of rampaging Craw Wurms.
cards.originalText: First strike, counts as a wall

cards.name: Wall of Stone
cards.text: Defender (This creature can't attack.)
cards.flavor: The Earth herself lends her strength to these walls of living stone, which possess the stability of ancient mountains. These mighty bulwarks thwart ground-based troops, providing welcome relief for weary warriors who defend the land.

cards.name: Wall of Swords
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Flying
cards.flavor: Just as the evil ones approached to slay Justina, she cast a great spell, imbuing her weapons with her own life force. Thus she fulfilled the prophecy: "In the death of your savior will you find salvation."
cards.originalText: Flying

cards.name: Wall of Water
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{U}: Wall of Water gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: A deafening roar arose as the fury of an enormous vertical river supplanted our serenity. Eddies turned into whirling geysers, leveling everything in their path.
cards.originalText: {U}: +1/+0 until end of turn

cards.name: Wall of Wood
cards.text: Defender (This creature can't attack.)
cards.flavor: Everybody knows that to ward off trouble, you knock on wood. But usually it's better to make a wall out of the wood and let trouble do the knocking.

cards.name: Wanderlust
cards.text:
Enchant creature
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted creature's controller, Wanderlust deals 1 damage to that player.
cards.originalText: Wanderlust deals 1 damage to target creature's controller during that player's upkeep.

cards.name: War Mammoth
cards.text: Trample
cards.flavor: I didn't think Mammoths could ever hold a candle to a well-trained battle horse. Then one day I turned my back on a drunken soldier. His blow never landed; Mi'cha flung the brute over ten meters.
cards.originalText: Trample

cards.name: Warp Artifact
cards.text:
Enchant artifact
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted artifact's controller, Warp Artifact deals 1 damage to that player.
cards.originalText: Warp Artifact deals 1 damage to target artifact's controller during his or her upkeep.

cards.name: Water Elemental
cards.flavor: Unpredictable as the sea itself, Water Elementals shift without warning from tranquility to tempest. Capricious and fickle, they flow restlessly from one shape to another, expressing their moods with their physical forms.

cards.name: Weakness
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets -2/-1.
cards.originalText: Target creature gets -2/-1.

cards.name: Web
cards.text:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
Enchanted creature gets +0/+2 and has reach. (It can block creatures with flying.)
cards.originalText: Target creature gets +0/+2 and can block creatures with flying.

cards.name: Whirling Dervish
cards.text:
Protection from black
At the beginning of each end step, if Whirling Dervish dealt damage to an opponent this turn, put a +1/+1 counter on it.

rulings.text: If it damages the opponent multiple times in a turn, it gets only one +1/+1 counter at end of turn.

cards.originalText:
Protection from black
Put a +1/+1 counter on Whirling Dervish at the end of each turn in which it damages opponent.

cards.name: White Knight
cards.text:
First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
Protection from black (This creature can't be blocked, targeted, dealt damage, or enchanted by anything black.)
cards.flavor: Out of the blackness and stench of the engulfing swamp emerged a shimmering figure. Only the splattered armor and ichor-stained sword hinted at the unfathomable evil the Knight had just laid waste.
cards.originalText: Protection from black, first strike

cards.name: White Mana Battery
cards.text:
{2}, {T}: Put a charge counter on White Mana Battery.
{T}, Remove any number of charge counters from White Mana Battery: Add {W} to your mana pool, then add an additional {W} to your mana pool for each charge counter removed this way.

rulings.text: Can be tapped even if it has no counters.

cards.originalText:
{2}, {T}: Put one charge counter on White Mana Battery.
{T}: Add {W} to your mana pool and remove as many charge counters as you wish. For each charge counter removed from White Mana Battery, add {W} to your mana pool. Play this ability as an interrupt.

cards.name: White Ward
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has protection from white. This effect doesn't remove White Ward.
cards.originalText: Target creature gains protection from white. The protection granted by White Ward does not destroy White Ward.

cards.name: Wild Growth
cards.text:
Enchant land
Whenever enchanted land is tapped for mana, its controller adds {G} to his or her mana pool (in addition to the mana the land produces).

rulings.text: The additional mana is not an ability of the land and is not something the land can produce.

cards.originalText: Wild Growth adds {G} to your mana pool each time target land is tapped for mana.

cards.name: Will-o'-the-Wisp
cards.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
{B}: Regenerate Will-o'-the-Wisp. (The next time this creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)
cards.flavor:
"About, about in reel and rout
The death-fires danced at night;
The water, like a witch's oils,
Burnt green, and blue and white."
—Samuel Coleridge, "The Rime of the Ancient Mariner"
cards.originalText:
Flying
{B}: Regenerate

cards.name: Winds of Change
cards.text: Each player shuffles the cards from his or her hand into his or her library, then draws that many cards.
cards.flavor:
"'Tis the set of sails, and not the gales, Which tells us the way to go."
—Ella Wheeler Wilcox

rulings.text: Each player draws a number of cards equal to the number of cards he or she shuffled into his or her own library.

cards.originalText: All players shuffle their hands into their libraries and then draw the same number of cards they originally held.

cards.name: Winter Blast
cards.text: Tap X target creatures. Winter Blast deals 2 damage to each of those creatures with flying.
cards.flavor: "Blow, winds, and crack your cheeks! rage! blow!" —William Shakespeare, King Lear

rulings.text: Winter Blast can target tapped creatures. If they have flying, the second part of the effect will still affect them.
Checks if the creatures are Flying on resolution and not on announcement. It's not a targeting restriction.

cards.originalText: Tap X target creatures. Winter Blast deals 2 damage to each of these target creatures with flying.

cards.name: Winter Orb
cards.text: As long as Winter Orb is untapped, players can't untap more than one land during their untap steps.

rulings.text: All permanents untap during a player's untap step at once. If Winter Orb is tapped as your untap step begins, your lands will all untap.
You can't tap Winter Orb just because you want to. Another ability, such as that of Glare of Subdual, must instruct or allow you to do so.

cards.originalText: No player may untap more than one land during his or her untap phase.

cards.name: Wooden Sphere
cards.text: Whenever a player casts a green spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.
cards.originalText: {1}: Gain 1 life for a successfully cast green spell. Use this effect either when the spell is cast or later in the turn but only once for each green spell cast.

cards.name: Word of Binding
cards.text: Tap X target creatures.
cards.flavor:
"That was the worst experience of my days: standing there helpless as they killed my whole troop."
—Maeveen O'Donagh, Memoirs of a Soldier
cards.originalText: Tap X target creatures.

cards.name: Wrath of God
cards.text: Destroy all creatures. They can't be regenerated.
cards.originalText: Bury all creatures.

cards.name: Xenic Poltergeist
cards.text: {T}: Until your next upkeep, target noncreature artifact becomes an artifact creature with power and toughness each equal to its converted mana cost.

rulings.text: Wears off at the beginning of the upkeep, not during upkeep.

A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of his or her most recent turn. It doesn't matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

cards.originalText: {T}: Target non-creature artifact becomes an artifact creature with power and toughness each equal to its casting cost. Target retains all original abilities. This change lasts until your next upkeep.

cards.name: Yotian Soldier
cards.text: Vigilance
cards.flavor: After Kroog was destroyed while most of its defenders were at his side, Urza vowed that none of his allies would ever need to fear for their own defense again, even while laying siege to a city far from their homes.
cards.originalText: Attacking does not cause Yotian Soldier to tap.

cards.name: Zephyr Falcon
cards.text: Flying, vigilance
cards.flavor: Although greatly prized among falconers, the Zephyr Falcon is capricious and not easily tamed.
cards.originalText:
Flying
Attacking does not cause Zephyr Falcon to tap.

cards.name: Zombie Master
cards.text:
Other Zombie creatures have swampwalk. (They can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
Other Zombies have "{B}: Regenerate this permanent."
cards.flavor: They say the Zombie Master controlled these foul creatures even before his own death, but now that he is one of them, nothing can make them betray him.
cards.originalText:
All zombies gain swampwalk and 
"{B} Regenerate."
